page.title: 12RICHARD SALTER
page.content: On a Tuesday in June of 1926 Richard Salter went to the Bearcroft. It was the custom of the school to let the older childen go out sketching. The Bearcroft is an old pond situated about 250 metres from school.Seven boys went out that afternoon. Only six returned. The headteacher usually made frequent checks on the children but did not stay with them all of the time.He was going to check with them when suddenly Willam Sincup came running in shouting "Rchard Salter is drowning".By the time the headteacher had arrived at the pool the village policeman was also there but no sign could be found of Richard.His body was recovered two hours later, it was found tangled in the weeds.Richard was 13 years old. .
